name: Time to kill the Bedroom Guardian
description:
This is my tribute to the Bedroom Nostalgia series of the great George Goodwin (@omgidrawedit) !
Pocket hallucinations is a triptych of animated collages for which I composed some small musical pieces for Harpsichord.
The story that runs through these scenes, is from when I was kidnapped by the Schizoid Bunnies.
A few words about the 3rd part:

III. Time to kill the Bedroom Guardian

While working at the keyboard,
one day I discovered that the lid of the bench could be removed.
Small amazement to see what they had forgotten inside it.
It was almost symbolic, a splendid hammer.
Just thinking about it made me uncomfortable, I was not ready to kill.
If you're not a demented murderer, it's not as simple as in the classic cartoons.
But the days passed and the confinement became desperate.
I began to ignore my own instincts,
to slowly give in to horrible ideas, to submerge myself in darkness.
And although my inner self was scandalized,
one night I made the decision
to kill the Bedroom Guardian.
There was a strange energy in the air.
I rang the doorbell for him to come and pick up my latest work.
He wasn't expecting it, he was moved to see himself portrayed. He was austere with me, but I had seen him through the window, confessing his sorrows to the daisies. I thought it was a nice motif, so I painted it.
With the work in his hands, he turned his back to me to hide his feelings. I knew he had cried when the droplets and her shining eyes leapt through the air. Her head sounded like a dinosaur egg cracking open.
My red polka dotted face was in shock.
I broke the chain, it was too loud, and escaped before the other bunnies arrived.
I ran trembling through the daisies without letting go of the bloody hammer.
Freedom sometimes requires sacrifices.
